DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable response to a question related to verified diagnosis through use of histology or histological techniques of non-small cell lung carcinoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to verified diagnosis through use of histology or histological techniques of Non-small cell lung carcinoma._A group of at least three distinct histological types of lung cancer, including squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, and large cell carcinoma.  Non-small cell lung carcinomas have a poor response to conventional chemotherapy.  --2002

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A group of at least three distinct histological types of lung cancer, including squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, and large cell carcinoma.  Non-small cell lung carcinomas have a poor response to conventional chemotherapy.  --2002

Concepts.definition: A group of at least three distinct histological types of lung cancer, including non-small cell squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, and large cell carcinoma. Non-small cell lung carcinomas have a poor response to conventional chemotherapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques.:Confirmed; having been established or verified.

Concepts.definition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have histologica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed diagnosis of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) within 5-years of study registration who is being evaluated for palliative WBRT (with or without neurosurgical resection or SRS) for radiologically or histologically diagnosed brain metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed malignancy with brain metastases and are being evaluated for palliative WBRT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed diagnosis of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), including neuroendocrine tumors or small cell lung cancer (SCLC) who are being evaluated for palliative WBRT (with or without neurosurgical resection or SRS) for radiologically or histologically diagnosed brain metastases presumed to be from the lung cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed malignancy with brain metastases and is being evaluated for palliative WBRT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed malignancy with brain metastases and is recommended for palliative WBRT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed, Stage IV NSCLC, with advanced or metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed NSCLC of predominantly squamous cell histology, Stage IV (AJCC 8th edition)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have newly diagnosed NSCLC, with no prior overlapping radiation therapy or systemic antineoplastic therapy delivered for locally advanced NSCLC?
